Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice with top of cul; glaze fired red-brown; white slip; interior glazed with trace of added white band near bottom; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (part of body with added red patch and hindquarters) to left with tail curling under belly; part of rising triangle as filling ornament; below, two brown bands above top of guilloche pattern in handle zone.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 259, no. 496, pl. 66) (Incorrectly labelled 1924.12-1.308)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0488) (phase 2)
